questions.question: After pre-processing and post-processing using SVD, what happens to the MIMO system?

answers.a: It works as an effective combining technique providing diversity gain
answers.b: It decomposes the channel into rank(H) parallel independent channels
answers.c: Since it involves multiplying input and output by a weight vector, it leads to increased power (array gain)

explanations.a: Incorrect. That describes diversity schemes, not SVD channel decomposition.
explanations.b: Correct. SVD diagonalizes the MIMO channel into rank(H) orthogonal subchannels, each behaving as an independent SISO link.
explanations.c: Incorrect. That effect is more related to beamforming/array gain.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The correct description is option b.

questions.question: Given H = [[1, 1], [1, -1]] × [[5, 0, 0], [0, 3, 0]] × [[1, 1, 0], [1, -1, 4], [2, -2, 1]], how many independent parallel streams can be formed?

answers.d: Cannot be determined from given info

explanations.a: Incorrect. The diagonal matrix shows more than one non-zero singular value.
explanations.b: Correct. The middle diagonal matrix shows two non-zero singular values, so the channel rank is 2, allowing 2 independent streams.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Only two non-zero singular values exist.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The rank can be determined from the given SVD form.

questions.question: In spatial multiplexing, what happens when the number of transmit antennas exceeds the number of receive antennas?

answers.a: All transmitted streams can always be reliably separated
answers.c: Some spatial streams may interfere with each other, degrading performance
answers.d: The receiver can ignore extra streams without any performance loss

explanations.a: Incorrect. This is not possible without enough receive dimensions to separate streams.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Capacity increase saturates when Nt > Nr.
explanations.c: Correct. If Nt > Nr, the extra streams cannot be fully separated, leading to inter-stream interference and reduced performance.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Ignoring streams wastes capacity but doesn't avoid interference in most cases.
